location_in_gene: Exon 5 or 3’ UTR depending on transcript
source: Hannan 2018, Mirkin 2007, GeneReviews,  SourceId: NBK535148, s40478-021-01201-x
notes: Two genes span the CTG/CAG repeat and are expressed in opposite directions: ATXN8, which encodes a nearly pure polyglutamine expansion protein in the CAG direction, and ATXN8OS (603680), which, when transcribed, produces a noncoding CUG expansion RNA (Moseley et al., 2006). Roda et al. suggested that the ATXN8 or ATXN8OS gene should not be evaluated in isolation as a candidate gene for spinocerebellar degenerative disease

Mechanism_detail: Role in heterochromatin or chromosomal structure theorized
source: OMIM, Sato 2009,    SourceId: 19878914 (Pubmed), https://doi.org/10.1038/s41580-021-00382-6
notes: Novel, STR-containing insertion, not present in reference genome: Reds disagree on normal/pathogenic sizes

disease: Frontotemporal dementia (FTD) and/or amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS)
Mechanism_detail: The HRE forms DNA and RNA G-quadruplexes with distinct structures and promotes RNA/DNA hybrids (R-loops). The structural polymorphism causes a repeat length-dependent accumulation of transcripts aborted in the HRE region.
source: Hannan 2018, GeneReviews, OMIM,  SourceId: NBK535148, s40478-021-01201-x
Prevalence: The expansion of a hexanucleotide repeat GGGGCC in C9orf72 is the most common known cause of ALS accounting for ~ 40% familial cases and ~ 7% sporadic cases in the European population

source: Hannan 2018, Mirkin 2007, GeneReviews,  SourceId: NBK535148, s40478-021-01201-x
